column4: guys, here is my xorg.conf file (screen section) http://pastebin.com/m19e8eeda, however, my screen resolution is always 1024x768 when i start up ubuntu!
what video card do you have ?
I suspect you are probably not using the right xorg video drivers
if you go to system -> administration -> hardware drivers menu - does it show an nvidia driver available
that's quite a late card so full support may not be available, lets see
how are you making it go to the higher res ?
intereting, as nvidia-settings normally changes and saves config to the xorg.conf
have you considered saving the changes it makes manually ?
didnt work, but the odd thing is: the load screen is 1280x1024, then it logs me in (auto-login) and the res changes to 1024x768
it seems to be your desktop rather than your overall x server, interesting
any ideas?
for your problem, thinking it thorugh in my head
never seen the xserver behave different from the desktop
hm it is odd, do you think it might be anything to do with autologin?
no idea, could be, but at this stage I don't know.....
trying to find a senario where the desktop would behave different from the xserver
ok, thanks :)
someone just made a good suggestion, your not using xnest or anything like that
not afaik, this is pretty much a fresh install
ok, more thinking required
looking through configs, can't see a way to change the desktop outside of the xorg
humm, what to do then?
not sure at this point
